user.title: Configure Service Result
user.description: Configure a sensor that exposes the response from a Home Assistant service call. You can copy the service data YAML directly from Developer Tools → Services.

data_description.name: A friendly name for this sensor (e.g., 'Tibber Prices')
data_description.service_domain: The domain of the service to call (e.g., 'tibber', 'weather')
data_description.service_name: The name of the service to call (e.g., 'get_price_info')
data_description.service_data_yaml: Optional YAML data to pass to the service. Copy from Developer Tools → Services.

reconfigure.title: Reconfigure Service Result
reconfigure.description: Update the service configuration for this sensor.

data_description.name: A friendly name for this sensor
data_description.service_domain: The domain of the service to call
data_description.service_name: The name of the service to call
data_description.service_data_yaml: Optional YAML data to pass to the service

error.service_not_found: Service not found. Verify the domain and service name.
error.yaml_parse_error: Invalid YAML syntax. Please check the service data.
error.yaml_not_dict: Service data must be a YAML dictionary (key: value pairs).

init.title: Configure Service Result Options
init.description: Adjust the service configuration and polling settings.

data_description.name: A friendly name for this sensor

data_description.service_name: The name of the service to call

data_description.scan_interval: How often to call the service (in seconds). Minimum 10 seconds.
